channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: This Week in Explainers: Will Pakistan suffer if India cuts access to Ravi waters?
Why has Trump imposed 10% tariffs after US SC ruling? What happens next?
Why US has seen no Andrew-like arrest after the Epstein files
Can cash-strapped Pakistan afford to redevelop New York’s Roosevelt Hotel with US?
How an Austrian climber left his girlfriend to die on county's highest mountain
‘Biryani gate’: How probe into Hyderabad food chains revealed Rs 70,000-crore tax scam
Can India trust BNP? The onus is on Tarique Rahman to rebuild trust and bury the ghosts of 2001
item.description: Rahman likely understands the indispensability of maintaining good relations with India as he tries to stabilise the economy and get Bangladesh back on track

item.title: Head-on | Rubio’s claim of a Western century is a myth: A declining West needs Global South to survive
item.description: The real message from Munich – and from a chastened Trump administration – is that the unity between the declining West and a rising South will shape the 21st century

item.title: How the time-tested India-France ties should come up in the AI yuga
item.description: In the new era, humanity will move from 'who knows more' to 'who understands consequences better'. Innovation and collaboration will play a crucial role, and France has been—and continues to be—a truly reliable friend

item.title: How Great Nicobar has a strategic role in the Great Game of Bay of Bengal
item.description: With environmental clearance, India’s strategic Great Nicobar project in the Bay of Bengal, with a firm eye on China, is ready to begin

item.title: India’s AI turn: From technological adoption to strategic leadership
item.description: AI will do for India what industrialisation did for early economic superpowers — but faster, broader, and more inclusively

item.title: Imran Khan letter: A well-meaning appeal that could complicate India’s diplomatic position
item.description: While Islamabad stays silent for strategic reasons, the letter written by 14 former cricket captains to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Imran Khan risks being turned into a diplomatic lever against New Delhi
